news.title: Budget 2026: REIT push, land acquisition relief and city-led growth boost real estate sector
news.para: The Union Budget 2026-27 introduces key initiatives for real estate and construction. It plans to monetize central public sector enterprise assets through REITs. A scheme will enhance construction equipment manufacturing. Tax exemptions are provided for compulsory land acquisition. Urban development in Tier II and Tier III cities receives a significant boost.

news.title: Budget 2026: Government to accelerate recycling of CPSE real estate assets through REITs
news.para: The Indian government will boost efforts to monetize real estate owned by public sector companies. This will be done using dedicated Real Estate Investment Trusts. This move aims to unlock value from public assets and generate revenue. It will also help channel institutional capital into infrastructure.

news.title: BDA layout residents set to join Greater Bengaluru authority’s democratic fold
news.para: Residents of several long-neglected BDA layouts in Bengaluru are set to gain democratic participation as the government initiates their handover to the Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA). This move will bring these areas under elected representation, structured municipal budgets, and grievance redressal mechanisms, promising improved civic governance and accountability for residents who have long awaited recognition within the city's administrative system.

news.title: Hyderabad: Over 15 lakh sq yards of TDR available with GHMC, mandatory use for high-rises raises costs
news.para: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation holds over 15 lakh sq yards of TDRs worth ₹2,000 crore, sufficient for the city's built-up demand for the next two to three years. A new rule mandates 10% TDR utilization for high-rises above 10 floors, aiming to benefit TDR holders amidst rising land acquisition costs.

news.title: Birla Corporation's  profit at ₹52.76 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Birla Corporation Ltd posted a net profit of Rs 52.76 crore for the December quarter of FY'26. This marks an increase from the Rs 31.19 crore profit recorded in the same period last year. The company's revenue from operations saw a slight dip.

news.title: Court grants bail to two realty firm employees in Noida techie death case
news.para: Ravi Bansal and Sachin Karanwal, two employees from Lotus Greens Construction Private Limited, have been granted bail after their arrest linked to the unfortunate drowning incident involving software engineer Yuvraj Mehta. Mehta's car reportedly drove into a flooded area near a construction site.

news.title: CREDAI seeks centralised STPs for safer operations in Visakhapatnam
news.para: CREDAI-Visakhapatnam is advocating for a centralized STP management system due to concerns over the operational efficiency and safety of plants in large apartment complexes. The association proposes community-level STPs managed by qualified agencies, with residents contributing user fees, to ensure better wastewater treatment and environmental compliance.

news.title: Why fire safety reports for condos missing? District magistrate to Noida authority
news.para: District Magistrate Medha Roopam has reprimanded Noida, Greater Noida, and Yamuna Expressway development authorities for failing to submit mandatory fire preparedness reports for high-rise societies. She also criticized the absence of senior officers at crucial disaster management meetings, demanding written explanations for both non-compliance and absenteeism.

news.title: NGT penalizes on Goa CZMA in sand mining cases
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has fined the Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority Rs 50,000 for repeated delays in filing replies for sand mining cases. The tribunal noted that 12 appeals challenging environmental clearances for sand extraction in CRZ areas were adjourned due to the authority's non-compliance.

news.title: Chandigarh administration set to rewrite industrial area rules
news.para: Chandigarh administration is set to relax industrial plot norms, increasing permitted coverage and removing mandatory central courtyards. This move aims to optimize land use and address industry concerns by replacing architectural controls with zoning parameters for smaller plots. The changes follow recommendations to boost industrial growth.

news.title: Over ₹303 crore in property taxes unpaid: Big commercial defaulters choke NMC
news.para: Nagpur Municipal Corporation faces a severe cash crunch, with Rs303 crore in outstanding property tax owed by 474 commercial defaulters. This significant amount, comprising arrears and penalties, could fund critical civic infrastructure projects like road repairs and sewage upgrades. Despite repeated recovery drives, these high-value defaulters continue to evade payment, highlighting a systemic failure in enforcement.

news.title: LIC Housing Finance's net profit declines 2.55% in Q3 FY26
news.para: LIC Housing Finance saw its net profit dip by 2.55 percent in the quarter ending December 31, 2025. Despite this, total income rose by 2.04 percent. The company noted sequential improvement in margins and asset quality. Disbursements for individual home loans and non-housing loans increased.

news.title: Noida: No OTS extension, 7,200 plot allottees face recovery from March 2026
news.para: Yamuna Expressway Authority rejects deadline extension for its one-time settlement scheme, pushing 7,200 defaulters towards recovery action by February 28.  In other decisions, six acres are allocated for a chief minister's school, and progress on stalled projects involving 6,800 homebuyers is noted. Master plans for Agra Urban City and Raya Heritage City are also moving forward.

news.title: Confident Group's founder shoots himself during I-T searches in Bengaluru
news.para: C J Roy, the esteemed chairman of Confident Group, died by suicide on Friday afternoon at his office, confirmed by Bengaluru Police, who stated he shot himself. This tragic incident occurred amid an ongoing three-day Income Tax search, with Roy's brother alleging that he faced intense pressure from federal agents.

news.title: Punjab & Haryana HC panel to measure width of roads after PIL filed against S+4 floor policy
news.para: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has ordered a physical inspection of internal roads in Gurugram's residential sectors. A three-member panel will verify road widths and conditions. This comes after a Public Interest Litigation challenged the state's stilt-plus-four construction policy. The court needs to establish facts on the ground.

news.title: Hong Kong’s luxury housing market sees rising interest with renewed city buzz
news.para: Hong Kong's housing market is showing signs of a robust comeback, with home prices experiencing their first annual increase in four years.

news.title: ED files supplementary prosecution complaint against Unnati Fortune Holdings in PMLA case
news.para: Enforcement Directorate's Lucknow office has filed a supplementary complaint against Unnati Fortune Holdings Ltd and its directors for alleged money laundering.  Investigations, stemming from UP Police FIRs, revealed diversion of around Rs126 crore by promoter Anil Mithas, who is in judicial custody.  Assets worth Rs126 crore have been attached.

news.title: Mortgage approvals in UK fall to lowest since June 2024, BoE data shows
news.para: In December, mortgage approvals in Britain plummeted to their lowest point in 18 months, sparking worries about the swift restoration of the housing market. Despite this setback, house prices experienced modest yearly increases, while indicators hint at a resurgence in buyer sentiment.

news.title: Eldeco Infrastructure and Properties gets Sebi's nod to float IPO
news.para: Haryana-based real estate developer Eldeco Infrastructure and Properties Ltd proposed public issue is a mix of fresh issues of shares worth Rs 800 crore and an offer for sale up to Rs 200 crore by promoters.

news.title: FIR lodged against builder, project head over open waterlogged pit in Greater Noida
news.para: A serious complaint has emerged in Greater Noida, where police have initiated legal action against a builder and his lead project supervisor. These individuals are accused of creating a dangerous situation by leaving an open pit brimming with contaminated water close to a busy public road.
